title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees at Fenway Park, getting just two hits in the series opener.
Boston committed three errors, including a costly catcher's interference call, enhancing the Yankees' lead.
Tensions are high as both teams vie for playoff positioning with postseason probabilities above 95%.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., former Patriots DE, suffered a season-ending quad injury during a game with the Washington Commanders.
The 31-year-old was injured blocking an extra point attempt and will require surgery as confirmed by ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Wise, a nine-year NFL veteran, signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early, Boston's No. 6 prospect, is a candidate for a starting role against the Athletics next week.
Early impressed with 11 strikeouts over five scoreless innings against the A's in his MLB debut.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora will decide on Early's rotation spot by Sunday, considering other young pitchers.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman's agent, Scott Boras, says opt-out decision will be made after the 2025 season.
Bregman signed a three-year, $120 million contract with the Red Sox in February 2025.
Bregman has a .279 average, 16 home runs, and 57 RBIs in the 2025 season despite a quad injury.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery,' a Stephen King adaptation, starring Kathy Bates, is available on HBO Max.
'Warfare,' co-directed by Ray Mendoza, is a combat film streaming on HBO Max.
'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 with Steve Martin is available on Hulu.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Keion White are ruled out for Patriots' Week 2 game against Miami due to hamstring and illness, respectively.
Patriots linebacker Marte Mapu (neck) and tackle Morgan Moses (foot) are listed as questionable for Sunday's game.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore and others are cleared to play against the Dolphins following full participation in practice.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins with Terrell Williams absent.
Kuhr, in his first season as inside linebackers coach, previously filled in as playcaller during spring practices.
Head coach Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr's abilities and preparation for the game against Miami.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in a federal fraud case in Boston, initially set for trial next month.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband were indicted for fraud related to their nonprofit and other financial crimes in 2022.
She faces a 27-count superseding indictment including charges like conspiracy, wire fraud, and tax violations, risking severe penalties.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, arrested on suspicion of shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, facing multiple felony charges.
Robinson, from Washington, Utah, alleged to have acted alone, reportedly became more political recently, court records show.
Robinson is a third-year electrical student at Dixie Technical College with no prior criminal records in state or federal courts.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees begin a crucial series at Fenway Park with major playoff implications.
Boston leads the season series against New York 8-2, showcasing dominance earlier this year.
Both teams to field top pitchers; Boston to start Giolito, Bello, Crochet; Yankees field Max Fried.
